item.title: [Malware Analysis] Is This Really Free to Watch? RedLine InfoStealer
item.description: You have become a victim of piracy. Although GitHub promotes an open-source culture where code can be publicly reviewed, this doesn’t mean it’s 100% safe.

item.title: [NSYSU Security Club] Intranet Penetration
item.description: Long time no club session - this time MacacaHub active member @Arikoi talks about intranet penetration. Listening through the whole session, I realized I’m unfamiliar with too many concepts, so I’ll try to organize the process. Please point out any errors!

item.title: [DEVCORE @HITCON2021] Wargame Web Challenge
item.description: Waaah I really wanted to get MASTER OF WEBSEC, but my skills wouldn’t allow me to challenge that title QQ This is my second time attending HITCON, and the on-site activities were really too many to cover :D

item.title: [Sharing] HITCON Education Defense 2021
item.description: Stop! Please stop shutting down our machines LAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA

item.title: [Sharing] ASIS CTF Quals 2020
item.description:
First CTF online of summer, also our MacacaHub’s third battle this year~ Though captain warned us it’d be difficult, prepare mentally. Yep, really hard QwQ 31 total challenges, solved only 4 but still Rank 151 / 815… terrifying==

CTFtime link

item.title: [Writeup] AIS3 2020 Pre-exam
item.description: My first time participating in the 3-day AIS3 pre-exam, so excited! >< Though at my age I’m a bit late. Seeing so many high school students participating made me wonder what I was doing in high school lol I’m used to seeking guidance from @stavhaygn during CTFTime online competitions, but this individual competition is all on me QwQ

item.title: [Writeup] TJCTF 2020 - Weak Password (Blind SQL injection)
item.description:
Writeup from MacacaHub TJCTF 2020 Writeups

Although this challenge is called Weak Password, I really couldn’t crack it at the time ;w;

After the competition, a teammate pointed out that it was actually a Blind SQL injection. My usual ' or 1=1 -- poking was really just child’s play lol

item.title: [NSYSU Security Club] Pwn Basic #1
item.description: After about a semester of CTF baptism, I finally have some understanding of this field :D Originally this blog was supposed to be technically-oriented, but somehow I’ve been using it for random posts instead…

item.title: [Sharing] 2019 CSC Cyber Security Competition Finals - All-You-Can-Eat McDonald's ฅ'ω'ฅ
item.description: Long time no post, just tidying up this dusty blog a bit (laughs) I’ve been in the security lab for three months without realizing it… And this CSC (Cyber Security Competition) was my first on-site cybersecurity competition!
